title: Sage Wisdom, Brought to you by Redneck Uncle Ken
body:
"Never take a leak up a hill, boi"

at first I didn't realize what he was even saying... but upon reflecting, it was actually a very wise statement.

after using some ancient redneck translation techniques passed down by generations of my family, I have found out the meaning of this sage wisdom.

It is a metaphor/microcosm for using sound judgement to avoid making decisions without consideration of future consequences. The phrase perfectly represents a very succinct philosophy of using potential future outcomes to guide your current life decisions. While it may seem like common knowledge, so many people do not give proper valuations of negative future situations. It is easy to dismiss something as a possibility, but when it could have been easily avoided, it never should have even been a possibility.

Anyway, I just thought i'd share some advice my family has been known to give. Anyone else have something crazy their family has told  them or always tells them?
